result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on December 2, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
Branch 2

8:36 AM Defendant Michael Davis Jr in court.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Michael Davis Jr.  Attorney Will Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim N.L.C. appeared by phone. Witness D.A. sworn and testifies. Direct exam by state. Venue established. Defendant identified. Atty Idlas with cross. Witness excused. Motions made; objection to bind over. Court makes findings and probable cause has been found.
Atty Jacob Idlas

3:24 PM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant Michael Davis Jr appeared by phone with the Courts approval.  Attorney Rebekah Rennicke in court for State of Wisconsin. NLC appears in court. Court addresses request for bail modification. Defendant makes oral motion and states his request for modification on the record. NLC makes a statement. State objects to modification and gives argument. Court makes findings denies the motion for modification bail at this time.

3:24 PM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant Michael Davis Jr appeared by phone with the Courts approval.  Attorney Rebekah Rennicke in court for State of Wisconsin. NLC appears in court. State does not object to a phone appearance. Defendant is in the process of retaining private counsel. Defendant waives time limits. Court will set for a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CT addresses time limits. CT finds good cause, CT sets STC. Defn requests bail hearing, State noticed for next hearing. Notice given to Defn in court.

2:30 PM Defendant Michael Davis Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis C Cuevas in court for Michael Davis Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
